node.title: U. of Nevada Student Dies After Being Injured at Fraternityâ€™s Amateur Boxing Event
node.alt: Nathan Valencia, right, died on Nov. 23, four days after this boxing match in Las Vegas.
node.description: Nathan Valencia, 20, died on Nov. 23 of brain injuries four days after headlining a charity boxing match, lawyers for his family said.
node.content: ["A 20-year-old student at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, died of brain injuries last week, four days after he headlined an amateur boxing match hosted by a fraternity and collapsed minutes after the three-round bout, lawyers for the student\u2019s family said.", "The student, Nathan Valencia, a junior, died on Nov. 23 at Sunrise Hospital in Las Vegas, where he was taken after the fight at Sahara Events Center in Las Vegas, the police said. He would have turned 21 years old on Saturday.", "The Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department said on Monday that it had investigated the licensing of the charity boxing event at which Mr. Valencia had been \u201ccritically injured\u201d and determined that \u201cthere is no information that there is any criminality on the part of the venue\u201d and that the death was not considered criminal. The Nevada Athletic Commission oversees \u201cunarmed combat events\u201d and those associated with promoting them, the police said.", "The Nevada Athletic Commission did not immediately respond to calls and emails on Monday seeking comment.", "The event, called Fight Night, is an annual tradition for the university\u2019s Kappa Sigma fraternity chapter to raise money for charity. This year\u2019s match was held on Nov. 19 and included students from other fraternities and sororities at the university.", "Mr. Valencia was a member of Sigma Alpha Epsilon, the lawyers for his family said. They emphasized that the event was not a hazing.", "In a statement issued through their lawyers on Friday, Mr. Valencia\u2019s family expressed heartbreak over his death and announced their intention to investigate how the university and its Kappa Sigma fraternity chapter allowed the boxing match to be held.", "\u201cCollege students should not be placed in a situation where they are pitted against each other for combat,\u201d the statement said. \u201cWe will leave no stone unturned to determine how a 20-year-old ended up in a school-sanctioned amateur fight that cost him his life.\u201d", "Mr. Valencia had no prior boxing experience and had never participated in a match before, his family\u2019s lawyers, Nick Lasso and Ryan Zimmer, said in an interview on Monday.", "In a statement on Friday, the president of the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, Keith E. Whitfield, said that the university was \u201ccommitting all available resources to review the incident and determine how off-campus events like these can be as safe as possible.\u201d", "The university on Monday confirmed that Mr. Valencia had been a junior majoring in kinesiology, but declined to answer further questions.", "The university\u2019s website notes that over the last two years, the Kappa Sigma fraternity chapter had raised more than $45,000 through events like Fight Night.", "Video footage of the evening match shows Mr. Valencia, clad in red boxing headgear, black boxing gloves and black shorts, darting around the ring and fielding blows to his chest and head. Less than five minutes after the match ended, Mr. Valencia collapsed, the family\u2019s lawyers said, adding that emergency workers arrived more than 10 minutes later.", "Mr. Valencia was pronounced brain dead before his death on Nov. 23, his family\u2019s lawyers said.", "In an interview with CNN on Monday, Cynthia Valencia, Mr. Valencia\u2019s mother, questioned the training of the referee in the match in which her son had participated. She added that there were no paramedics on standby for the match.", "Ms. Valencia said she had asked her son before the match why he was billed as the headliner, despite his lack of experience in the ring. He reassured her that all participants were amateur boxers, that he would be wearing headgear, and that he would be raising funds for charity, she said in the interview.", "Mitchell B. Wilson, the executive director of Kappa Sigma, said on Monday that the fraternity was \u201cgreatly saddened by the loss of Nathan Valencia at the University of Nevada, Las Vegas.\u201d He did not respond to further questions about Mr. Valencia\u2019s death.", "The university\u2019s Kappa Sigma chapter did not immediately respond to requests for comment on Monday.", "The Valencia family is seeking accountability for Nathan\u2019s death and \u201cmore than anything, wants to make sure that this never happens again,\u201d Mr. Lasso said, adding that they believed that Fight Night had been held by the university\u2019s Kappa Sigma chapter for at least a dozen years.", "\u201cWe believe that throughout the last 12 years there have been various injuries that required medical treatment,\u201d Lasso said. \u201cOur obligation is to be able to put an end to this.\u201d"]
